page.title: 10Accommodation in Crawford.
page.content: The Heatherghyll is a licensed hotel. Most people who come to stay at the Heatherghyll are transport drivers. Some stop for lunches,locals can come for a drink.The Heatherghyll has little seasonal trade.The Holmes' who own the Heatherghyll have lived there since 1972.It can take 16 guests.It opens at 6am and closes at 11pm. The Merlindale Cafe is unlicensed.It also caters for transport drivers and can take 20 guests.The Hays who own the Merlindale have been there since 1983.They would like to improve it with public support.It opens at 6am and closes at 7pm. Other hotels in Crawford are Tudor House,Crawford Arms,Post Horn And Lindsay Towers.They all cater for transport drivers as well as the tourist trade.Several houses do bed and breakfast during the summer.
